beginner.question: Who wrote the Book of Revelation?
beginner.explanation: John, the beloved disciple, wrote Revelation while exiled on the island of Patmos around 95 AD.

beginner.question: In which city was Jesus born?
beginner.explanation: Jesus was born in Bethlehem, fulfilling the prophecy in Micah 5:2.

beginner.question: How many disciples did Jesus choose?
beginner.explanation: Jesus chose 12 disciples to be His closest followers and apostles.

beginner.question: Who baptized Jesus?
beginner.explanation: John the Baptist baptized Jesus in the Jordan River, marking the beginning of His ministry.

beginner.question: What was Matthews profession?
beginner.explanation: Matthew was a tax collector before Jesus called him.

beginner.question: Which disciple denied Jesus three times?
beginner.explanation: Peter denied knowing Jesus three times before the rooster crowed.

beginner.question: On which day did Jesus rise?
beginner.explanation: Jesus rose from the dead on Sunday, the first day of the week.

beginner.question: Who first saw Jesus after resurrection?
beginner.explanation: Mary Magdalene was the first to see the risen Jesus at the tomb.

beginner.question: What is the shortest verse?
beginner.explanation: Jesus wept (John 11:35) is the shortest verse in the Bible.

beginner.question: How many NT books?
beginner.explanation: The New Testament contains 27 books.

beginner.question: What was the greatest commandment?
beginner.explanation: Love the Lord your God with all your heart, soul, and mind.

beginner.question: Who betrayed Jesus?
beginner.explanation: Judas Iscariot betrayed Jesus for 30 pieces of silver.

beginner.question: Garden where Jesus prayed?
beginner.explanation: Jesus prayed in the Garden of Gethsemane before His arrest.

beginner.question: Who buried Jesus?
beginner.explanation: Joseph of Arimathea asked for Jesus body and buried Him.

beginner.question: Days Jesus in tomb?
beginner.explanation: Jesus was in the tomb for three days before rising.

beginner.question: Angel said at tomb?
beginner.explanation: The angel told the women He is risen.

beginner.question: Who wrote most NT letters?
beginner.explanation: Paul wrote 13 of the 27 books in the New Testament.

beginner.question: Paul converted where?
beginner.explanation: Paul was traveling to Damascus when Jesus appeared to him.

beginner.question: Pauls companion?
beginner.explanation: Barnabas was Pauls companion on his first missionary journey.

beginner.question: Jesus raised in?
beginner.explanation: Jesus was raised in Nazareth.

beginner.question: First four Gospels?
beginner.explanation: The four Gospels are Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John.

beginner.question: Holy Spirit came on?
beginner.explanation: The Holy Spirit came upon the disciples at Pentecost.

beginner.question: First Christian martyr?
beginner.explanation: Stephen was the first Christian martyr, stoned for his faith.

beginner.question: Greatest is love in?
beginner.explanation: 1 Corinthians 13 is known as the love chapter.

beginner.question: Lords Prayer in?
beginner.explanation: The Lords Prayer is found in Matthew 6:9-13.

beginner.question: Beatitudes taught where?
beginner.explanation: Jesus taught the Beatitudes in the Sermon on the Mount.

beginner.question: Jesus ascended from?
beginner.explanation: Jesus ascended to heaven from the Mount of Olives.

beginner.question: Which disciple was a fisherman?
beginner.explanation: Peter was a fisherman before Jesus called him.

beginner.question: Zacchaeus was a?
beginner.explanation: Zacchaeus was a chief tax collector.

beginner.question: Good Samaritan taught?
beginner.explanation: The Good Samaritan parable teaches us to love our neighbor.

beginner.question: Prodigal son returned to?
beginner.explanation: The prodigal son returned to his father who welcomed him.

beginner.question: Jesus healed how many lepers?
beginner.explanation: Jesus healed ten lepers but only one returned to thank Him.

beginner.question: Woman at well from?
beginner.explanation: The woman at the well was from Samaria.

beginner.question: Last book of NT?
beginner.explanation: Revelation is the last book of the New Testament.

beginner.question: Jesus washed disciples?
beginner.explanation: Jesus washed the disciples feet to demonstrate servant leadership.

beginner.question: Doubting disciple?
beginner.explanation: Thomas doubted Jesus resurrection until he saw Him.

beginner.question: Bread of life said in?
beginner.explanation: Jesus declared I am the bread of life in Johns Gospel.

beginner.question: Fruit of Spirit in?
beginner.explanation: The fruit of the Spirit is listed in Galatians.

beginner.question: Armor of God in?
beginner.explanation: The armor of God is described in Ephesians 6.

beginner.question: Faith chapter?
beginner.explanation: Hebrews 11 is known as the faith chapter.

beginner.question: Golden rule in?
beginner.explanation: Do to others as you would have them do to you is in Matthew.

beginner.question: Greatest of these is?
beginner.explanation: The greatest of these is love.

beginner.question: Jesus hometown?
beginner.explanation: Jesus grew up in Nazareth.

beginner.question: Paul was from?
beginner.explanation: Paul was from Tarsus in Cilicia.

beginner.question: Book of Acts written by?
beginner.explanation: Luke wrote both the Gospel of Luke and the Book of Acts.

beginner.question: Wise men brought?
beginner.explanation: The wise men brought gold, frankincense, and myrrh.

beginner.question: Jesus tempted how many days?
beginner.explanation: Jesus was tempted in the wilderness for 40 days.

beginner.question: Transfiguration witnesses?
beginner.explanation: Peter, James, and John witnessed Jesus transfiguration.

beginner.question: Last Supper celebrated?
beginner.explanation: The Last Supper was a Passover meal.

beginner.question: Jesus arrested in?
beginner.explanation: Jesus was arrested in the Garden of Gethsemane.

beginner.question: Jesus tried by?
beginner.explanation: Jesus was tried by both Herod and Pilate.

beginner.question: Jesus crucified between?
beginner.explanation: Jesus was crucified between two thieves.

beginner.question: Jesus last words?
beginner.explanation: Jesus said It is finished before dying on the cross.

beginner.question: Great Commission in?
beginner.explanation: The Great Commission is found in Matthew 28:19-20.

beginner.question: First miracle?
beginner.explanation: Jesus first miracle was turning water into wine at Cana.

beginner.question: Fed 5000 with?
beginner.explanation: Jesus fed 5000 with 5 loaves and 2 fish.

beginner.question: Walked on water?
beginner.explanation: Jesus walked on the Sea of Galilee.

beginner.question: Raised from dead?
beginner.explanation: Jesus raised all three from the dead during His ministry.

beginner.question: Healed blind man with?
beginner.explanation: Jesus healed a blind man using mud made with spit.

beginner.question: Pentecost how many baptized?
beginner.explanation: About 3000 were baptized at Pentecost.

beginner.question: Jesus had 12 disciples.
beginner.explanation: True! Jesus chose 12 disciples.

beginner.question: Jesus was born in Jerusalem.
beginner.explanation: False! Jesus was born in Bethlehem.

beginner.question: Peter walked on water.
beginner.explanation: True! Peter walked on water toward Jesus.

beginner.question: Water to wine was first miracle.
beginner.explanation: True! This miracle occurred at a wedding in Cana.

beginner.question: There are 30 NT books.
beginner.explanation: False! There are 27 books in the New Testament.

beginner.question: John the Baptist baptized Jesus.
beginner.explanation: True! John baptized Jesus in the Jordan River.

beginner.question: Jesus was a carpenter.
beginner.explanation: True! Jesus worked as a carpenter before His ministry.

beginner.question: Matthew was a fisherman.
beginner.explanation: False! Matthew was a tax collector.

beginner.question: Jesus rose on Sunday.
beginner.explanation: True! Jesus rose on the first day of the week, Sunday.

beginner.question: Judas betrayed Jesus for silver.
beginner.explanation: True! Judas betrayed Jesus for 30 pieces of silver.

beginner.question: Jesus was 40 when ministry began.
beginner.explanation: False! Jesus was about 30 years old.

beginner.question: Paul wrote Revelation.
beginner.explanation: False! John wrote Revelation.

beginner.question: Jesus wept is shortest verse.
beginner.explanation: True! John 11:35 is the shortest verse.

beginner.question: Peter denied Jesus twice.
beginner.explanation: False! Peter denied Jesus three times.

beginner.question: Pentecost gave Holy Spirit.
beginner.explanation: True! The Holy Spirit came at Pentecost.

beginner.question: Stephen was first martyr.
beginner.explanation: True! Stephen was the first Christian martyr.

beginner.question: Paul was born in Rome.
beginner.explanation: False! Paul was from Tarsus.

beginner.question: Jesus fed 5000 people.
beginner.explanation: True! Jesus miraculously fed 5000 with bread and fish.

beginner.question: Mary Magdalene was Jesus mother.
beginner.explanation: False! Mary was Jesus mother, Mary Magdalene was a follower.

beginner.question: Jesus was tempted 40 days.
beginner.explanation: True! Jesus was tempted in the wilderness for 40 days.

beginner.question: Beatitudes are in John.
beginner.explanation: False! Beatitudes are in Matthew 5.

beginner.question: Lords Prayer is in Matthew.
beginner.explanation: True! The Lords Prayer is in Matthew 6.

beginner.question: Jesus raised Lazarus.
beginner.explanation: True! Jesus raised Lazarus from the dead.

beginner.question: Paul wrote 20 NT books.
beginner.explanation: False! Paul wrote 13 books.

beginner.question: Jesus ascended from Mount of Olives.
beginner.explanation: True! Jesus ascended from the Mount of Olives.

beginner.question: There are 4 Gospels.
beginner.explanation: True! Matthew, Mark, Luke, and John.

beginner.question: Jesus spoke Aramaic.
beginner.explanation: True! Aramaic was the common language of Jesus time.

beginner.question: Zacchaeus was tall.
beginner.explanation: False! Zacchaeus was short and climbed a tree to see Jesus.

beginner.question: Good Samaritan helped injured man.
beginner.explanation: True! The Samaritan helped the man beaten by robbers.

beginner.question: Prodigal son had two brothers.
beginner.explanation: False! He had one brother.

beginner.question: Jesus washed disciples feet.
beginner.explanation: True! Jesus washed their feet as an example of humility.

beginner.question: Thomas doubted resurrection.
beginner.explanation: True! Thomas doubted until he saw Jesus.

beginner.question: Jesus was sinless.
beginner.explanation: True! Jesus lived a sinless life.

beginner.question: Paul was always a Christian.
beginner.explanation: False! Paul persecuted Christians before his conversion.

beginner.question: Jesus calmed a storm.
beginner.explanation: True! Jesus calmed a storm on the Sea of Galilee.

beginner.question: All disciples were martyred.
beginner.explanation: False! John died of natural causes in old age.

beginner.question: Jesus healed on Sabbath.
beginner.explanation: True! Jesus healed on the Sabbath, angering religious leaders.

beginner.question: Mary and Martha were sisters.
beginner.explanation: True! Mary and Martha were sisters of Lazarus.

beginner.question: Jesus was 50 when crucified.
beginner.explanation: False! Jesus was about 33 years old.

beginner.question: Great Commission says make disciples.
beginner.explanation: True! Jesus commanded to make disciples of all nations.

beginner.question: Who built the ark?
beginner.explanation: Noah built the ark as commanded by God.

beginner.question: Rain during flood?
beginner.explanation: It rained for 40 days and 40 nights.

beginner.question: Who was swallowed by fish?
beginner.explanation: Jonah was swallowed by a great fish.

beginner.question: First day creation?
beginner.explanation: On the first day, God created light.

beginner.question: Strongest man?
beginner.explanation: Samson was known for his supernatural strength.

beginner.question: Moses parted Red Sea.
beginner.explanation: True! God parted the Red Sea through Moses.

beginner.question: David killed Goliath with sword.
beginner.explanation: False! David killed Goliath with a stone from his sling.

beginner.question: There are 10 commandments.
beginner.explanation: True! God gave Moses the Ten Commandments.

beginner.question: Jesus earthly parents?
beginner.explanation: Joseph and Mary were the earthly parents who raised Jesus.

beginner.question: Jesus began ministry at age?
beginner.explanation: Jesus was about 30 years old when He began His ministry.

beginner.question: Loaves to feed 5000?
beginner.explanation: Jesus used 5 loaves and 2 fish to feed the 5000.

beginner.question: Jesus first miracle?
beginner.explanation: Jesus first miracle was turning water into wine at Cana.

beginner.question: Raised after 4 days?
beginner.explanation: Jesus raised Lazarus after four days in the tomb.
